data.title: Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Loyalty Program Review
data.meta_description: The Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards loyalty program offers perks including the Companion Pass, points earning, and reward flights.
data.text:
Southwest Airlines Overview

While Southwest started as a budget airline, today itâs one of the largest U.S. airlines. Southwest has continued to expand its offerings with flights to Hawaii and several popular international destinations, including Mexico, Central America, and the Caribbean.

Despite difficulties at the end of 2022 that resulted in an operational meltdown, Southwest remains a favorite airline for many travelers due to its customer-friendly policies, such as free checked bags and no change fees.

Rapid Rewards is the airlineâs loyalty program that allows passengers to earn and use points for flights.

How To Join Southwest Rapid Rewards

Visit the Southwest website and click Create account to join for free.

How To Sign In to Your Rapid Rewards Account

You can sign in to your Rapid Rewards account on the Southwest.com homepage. Youâll need your account number or username and password.

Viewing Your Account Activity

After logging in, click on My Account to see a summary of your trips, points, promotions, and progress toward elite status.

Points Expiration

Rapid Rewards points donât expire if your account is open and in good standing.

Southwest Rapid Rewards Elite Status and Companion Pass

There are 2 levels of Southwest Airlines elite status â A-List and A-List Preferred. The Southwest Companion Pass isnât technically an elite status, as having the pass doesnât come with any elite benefits, but it offers huge perks when flying on Southwest Airlines.

Southwest A-List Status

Southwest A-List status is earned after flying 20 qualifying one-way flights or earning 35,000 tier-qualifying points in a calendar year.

Tier qualifying points are only earned in 2 ways â through paid Southwest flights or credit card spending. You can earn 1,500 TQP per $5,000 spent on select Southwest credit cards

A-List status comes with the following benefits:

25% point bonus

Dedicated A-List member phone line

Free same-day standby

Priority boarding

Priority check-in and security

Same-day confirmed changes with no difference in base fare

Southwest A-List Preferred Status

Southwest A-List Preferred status is earned after flying 40 qualifying one-way flights or earning 70,000 tier-qualifying points in a calendar year. It comes with all of the benefits of A-List status plus these additional perks:

100% point bonus

Dedicated A-List Preferred member phone line

Free inflight Wi-Fi

Southwest Companion Pass

The Southwest Companion Pass is considered one of the best deals in travel. It essentially lets you fly 2-for-1 for up to 2 years.

To earn the Companion Pass, youâll need to fly 100 qualifying one-way flights in a calendar year or earn 135,000 qualifying points in a calendar year.

Companion Pass qualifying points include credit card welcome bonuses plus points earned from revenue flights, Southwest credit card spending, partner hotel and car rentals, Rapid Rewards dining, and Rapid Rewards shopping.

After earning the Companion Pass, you can add a companion to any Southwest ticket for the rest of the calendar year in which you earn the pass plus the entire following calendar year. All you need to do is pay the taxes and fees for the companion, which are $5.60 for a domestic one-way flight (taxes and fees are higher on international flights).

Value of Rapid Rewards Elite Status

One of the most significant benefits of A-List and A-List Preferred status is priority boarding. Southwestâs boarding process differs from other airlines because there are no assigned seats. Instead, youâre assigned a boarding position based on a few factors, including when you check in and your status level.

Having Southwest elite status removes the need to check in exactly 24 hours ahead of time and more or less guarantees youâll be able to get seats with your traveling companions â and wonât get stuck in a middle seat.

If you generally pay for EarlyBird Check-In or value not having to worry about your boarding position, Southwestâs elite status can be very valuable.

How To Earn Southwest Rapid Rewards Points

There are many ways to earn Rapid Rewards points.

Flying on Southwest Airlines

You earn Rapid Rewards points for Southwest flights based on your fare type and price, excluding taxes and fees:

Business Select: 12 points per dollar

Anytime: 10 points per dollar

Wanna Get Away Plus:Â 8 points per dollar

Wanna Get Away:Â 6 points per dollar

Travelers with A-List status earn additional bonus points.

A-List:Â 25% bonus Rapid Rewards points

A-List Preferred:Â 100% bonus Rapid Rewards points

Earn Points With Travel Partners

You can earn Rapid Rewards points by booking travel through select travel partners.

Car rental partners: Alamo, Avis, Budget, Dollar, Hertz, National, Payless, Thrifty

Hotel partners: SouthwestHotels.com, Best Western, Radisson Rewards Americas, Choice Hotels, Hyatt, Marriott, MGM Rewards, Rocketmiles

Earn Points With Shopping, Dining, and Specialty Partners

Southwest has a variety of ways to earn Rapid Rewards points without flying, including shopping, dining, home, and specialty partners that can help you earn more Rapid Rewards points.

1-800 Flowers

Emergency Assistance Plus

eRewards

Laithwaiteâs Wines

Harry & David

Home Chef

NRG

Rapid Rewards Dining

Rapid Rewards Shopping

Reliant

Rewards for Opinions

Earn Points With Credit Cards

Southwest offers 5 co-branded credit cards:

You can also earn Rapid Rewards points through Ultimate Rewards credit cards since Chase and Southwest are 1:1 transfer partners.

You need at least 1 premium travel rewards card (marked **) to transfer to Southwest. As long as you have 1 eligible transfer card, you can consolidate all your Ultimate Rewards points to that card to then transfer them to Southwest (or any of Chaseâs other partners).

Branded and Partnered Credit Cards

You can use several credit cards to earn Rapid Rewards points directly or through points transfers.

Southwest Rapid Rewards Credit Cards

You can earn Rapid Rewards directly with any of the 5 Southwest co-branded Chase cards. First, letâs take a look at the 3 consumer cards available.

U.P. RatingÂ

Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse.

Not only does the card offer multiple bonus categories to help you earn more Southwest Rapid Rewards points, but it is also loaded with benefits that are sure to offer quite a bit of value to Southwest flyers.

Here is a full overview of the card to help you decide if it is a good fit for your wallet.

Pros

3x points per $1 on Southwest purchases

2x points per $1 on local transit and commuting, including rideshare purchases

2x points per $1 on internet, cable, phone services, and select streaming purchases

Cons

Does not earn transferable points

Chase Ultimate Rewards Credit Cards

Chase Ultimate RewardsÂ points transfer to Southwest Airlines at a 1:1 ratio. That means you can take advantage of the numerous bonus categories on Chase Ultimate Rewards cards to earn lots of points, which can be instantly transferred to Southwest.

The Chase Sapphire PreferredÂ® card is one of the best travel rewards cards on the market. Its bonus categories include travel, dining, online grocery purchases, and streaming services, which gives you the opportunity to earn lots of bonus points on these purchases.

Additionally, it offers flexible point redemption options, no foreign transaction fees, and excellent travel insurance coverage including primary car rental insurance. With benefits like these, itâs easy to see why this card is an excellent choice for any traveler.

The card combines elite travel benefits and perks like airport lounge access, with excellent point earning and redemption options.Â Plus it offers top-notch travel insurance protections to keep you covered whether youâre at home or on the road.

How To Redeem Southwest Rapid Rewards Points

Southwest awards are only available on Southwest flights and are revenue-based, so the price in points will be based on the cash cost. Finding awards is straightforward. Search on Southwest.com, and if a flight is available to book in cash, it will also be available to book using points.

You can easily toggle back and forth between the points and cash costs of any flight. The dollar amount shown under the points price is the taxes and fees.

The information regarding the Chase Freedom Flexâ was independently collected by Upgraded Points and not provided nor reviewed by the issuer.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Southwest Rapid Rewards? Is it worth it? What does itÂ cost?

The Southwest Airlines frequent flyer program is calledÂ Southwest Rapid Rewards. It is similar toÂ other airline loyalty programsÂ in that you sign up, earn points and elite status, and redeem for rewards.

It is a free program, which means the benefits are typically worth the effort ofÂ signing up.

What are the benefits of Southwest Rapid Rewards?

Once youâve signed up for Rapid Rewards, you gain the ability to earn and use points on flights as well as the opportunity to earn elite status.

Rapid Rewards points are easy to earn, and there are no blackout dates when it comes time to redeem them. If a flight is available in cash, it can be booked with points.

Southwestâs elite status tiers areÂ A-ListÂ andÂ A-List Preferred, and benefits include priority boarding and bonus points.

In addition to using points to book rewards tickets, you can also use your points onÂ travel partners. These include hotels and rental cars as well as shopping and more.

Where is my Southwest Rapid Rewards number?

If you have it available, you can find your Rapid Rewards number by signing into your account with your email and password; your number will be shown on the My Account screen.

You can always call Southwest customer service to find your number.

What is the Southwest Rapid Rewards login? How do I sign up?

You can log in to theÂ Southwest Rapid Rewards program and sign up for the program.

When do Southwest Rapid Rewards expire?

Southwest Rapid Rewards points donât expire as long as your account is active and in good standing.

What are Southwest Rapid Rewards points worth?

Southwest Rapid Rewards points are worth about 1.3 cents each.

Are Southwest Rapid Rewards points refundable?

Yes, if you cancel a Southwest flight that is booked with points, your points will be redeposited into your account.

Are Southwest Rapid Rewards points transferable?

Yes, Rapid Rewards points are transferable, but itâs expensive. Youâll pay $5 per 500 points transferred with a minimum of 2,000 points per transaction. A better option would be to use them to book a flight for someone else.

What are theÂ Southwest Rapid Rewards partners?

While aÂ complete list can be found here, some of them include:

Best Western, Choice Hotels, Hyatt, Marriott, Avis, Hertz, Dollar, 1-800-Flowers, and Reliant Energy.

What is the Southwest Companion Pass?

The Southwest Companion Pass is the highest award in the Rapid Rewards program.

Once youâve reached 100 one-way flights or earned 135,000 qualifying points in a calendar year, you can take a companion on any flight with you for just the cost of the taxes and fees, which in the U.S. are $5.60 each way.

This status is good immediately once you meet the requirements through the remainder of the following calendar year. For example, a Companion Pass earned in October 2023 will be valid through December 2024.
